Recommendations: Encourage faculty members to finish their master's degrees.
Orientation programs for newly hired employees and faculty members should be conducted on a regular basis or as the need arises.
In-service training can be held regularly, e.g., once every semester.

Consider updating the syllabi to include updated topics and reference books/materials. Devise a grading system that is uniform. Likewise, include on the cover page the semester and school year when it was prepared.

Encourage more faculty members to prepare instructional materials and have them copyrighted. If the instructional materials will be sold to students, they must be coursed through an office or an entity in the Institution to be a part of the income generating project of the department. If there is still no entity or office to do this, the MMSU can look into other colleges and universities which are already doing this.
Devise a system or mechanism to be able to regularly check the attendance of faculty members.
Encourage faculty members to attend seminars/training, symposia, etc., to enhance their teaching capabilities.
Classify and arrange documents according to the benchmark statements of the survey instrument. Package documents in such a way that they can be looked into easily.
Pictures can be attached to prove faculty activities like extension, consultation, faculty orientation, etc.
